com.iota.iri.service.transactionpruning

Interface TransactionPruner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsyncTransactionPruner

    public interface TransactionPruner
    Represents the manager for the cleanup jobs that are issued by the LocalSnapshotManager in connection with local snapshots and eventually other parts of the code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addJob(TransactionPrunerJob job)
      This method adds a job to the TransactionPruner, that consequently can be executed by the processJobs() method.
      void clear()
      This method removes all queued jobs and resets the state of the TransactionPruner.
      void processJobs()
      This method executes all jobs that where added to the TransactionPruner through addJob(TransactionPrunerJob).
      void restoreState()
      Restores the state of the TransactionPruner after being saved before by saveState().
      void saveState()
      This method saves the current state of the TransactionPruner, so it can later be restored by restoreState().

    • Method Detail

      • addJob

        void addJob(TransactionPrunerJob job)
     throws TransactionPruningException
        This method adds a job to the TransactionPruner, that consequently can be executed by the processJobs() method. In addition to adding the jobs to the internal list of jobs that have to be executed, it informs the job about the TransactionPruner, the Tangle, the TipsViewModel and the Snapshot instances that this job is working on.
        Parameters:
        job - the job that shall be executed
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if anything goes wrong while adding the job

      • processJobs

        void processJobs()
          throws TransactionPruningException
        This method executes all jobs that where added to the TransactionPruner through addJob(TransactionPrunerJob). The jobs will only be executed exactly once before being removed from the TransactionPruner.
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if anything goes wrong while processing the jobs

      • saveState

        void saveState()
        throws TransactionPruningException
        This method saves the current state of the TransactionPruner, so it can later be restored by restoreState(). It is used to maintain the state between IRI restarts and pick up pruning where it stopped when IRI shut down.
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if anything goes wrong while saving the current state

      • restoreState

        void restoreState()
           throws TransactionPruningException
        Restores the state of the TransactionPruner after being saved before by saveState(). It is used to keep the state between IRI restarts and pick up pruning where it stopped when IRI shut down.
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if anything goes wrong while restoring the state

      • clear

        void clear()
    throws TransactionPruningException
        This method removes all queued jobs and resets the state of the TransactionPruner. It can for example be used to cleanup after tests.
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if anything goes wrong while clearing the jobs
